CONCLUSION: Pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses award - Convention proceedings;Costs and expenses - claim dismissed
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , a NORP national , grew up in GPE in northern GPE . In DATE she married and moved with her husband to GPE .

CARDINAL . She is the owner of plots of land nos . DATE , CARDINAL , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL in GPE . Prior to the NORP occupation of northern GPE on DATE , work had commenced on plot no . CARDINAL for the construction of a block of flats , CARDINAL of which was intended as a home for her family . The applicant had entered into an agreement with the property developer to exchange her share in the land for an apartment of QUANTITY m. Her ownership of the properties is attested by certificates of registration issued by LOC and ORG at the moment of acquisition .
CARDINAL . NORP Since DATE the applicant has been prevented from gaining access to her properties in northern GPE and “ peacefully enjoying ” them as a result of the presence of NORP forces there .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant participated in a march organised by a women ’s group ( “ Women Walk Home ” movement ) in the village of Lymbia near the NORP village of ORG in the occupied area of northern GPE . The aim of the march was to assert the right of NORP refugees to return to their homes .

Leading a group of CARDINAL marchers she advanced up a hill towards ORG in the NORP - occupied part of GPE passing ORG guard post on the way . When they reached the churchyard they were surrounded by NORP soldiers and prevented from moving any further . She was detained by the NORP police for a period of ten hours and subsequently released .
